sentences.english: The name Baobab commands respect in many sectors of the galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 貝歐巴這個名字在銀河系許多星區受人敬仰。

sentences.english: Each galaxy contains myriads of stars.
sentences.chinese: 地球是銀河系中的星球之一。

sentences.english: Coruscant continued as the capital of the galaxy under this new regime.
sentences.chinese: 在這個新政權的統治下，科洛桑依然是銀河系的首都。

sentences.english: We of the Ashtar Galactic Command thank you for your attention.
sentences.chinese: 我們，阿西塔銀河系的指揮部，感謝你們的注意。

sentences.english: Through the Force, Yoda felt the sudden loss of life across the galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 尤達通過原力感到，許多生命突然在銀河系中消失了。

sentences.english: We of the Ashtar Galactic Command thank you for your attention.
sentences.chinese: 我們阿西塔銀河系的統帥們，感謝你們的注意。

sentences.english: Immediately, the center of the galaxy looks incredibly fluffy.
sentences.chinese: 乍看起來，銀河系中心似乎很蓬鬆。

sentences.english: The three spiky stars are in our own Milky Way galaxy
sentences.chinese: 那三顆大釘般的恆星位於我們自己的銀河系。

sentences.english: The first planet of extra-galactic origin in the Milky Way has been found.
sentences.chinese: 第一顆起源於外星系的行星在銀河系中被發現。

sentences.english: She rarely had to access the Jedi archives; her knowledge of galactic politics was immense.
sentences.chinese: 她通曉銀河系的政治狀況，幾乎不用去查絕地檔案館。

sentences.english: Some astronomers thought nebulae were part of our Milky Way Galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 一些天文學家認爲星雲是銀河系的一部分。

sentences.english: Hurtling through the galaxy, faster than a speeding sun.
sentences.chinese: 飛馳通過銀河系，比太陽的速度還快。

sentences.english: The Milky Way Galaxy is the inspiration for the symbol of the Ouroboros.
sentences.chinese: 銀河系是銜尾蛇標記的靈感。

sentences.english: He was now known as Emperor Palpatine, supreme ruler of the galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 他是爲白卜庭皇帝，銀河系之最高統治者。

sentences.english: Mr. Adams's pictures about the Galaxy were shown in a famous gallery.
sentences.chinese: 亞當斯先生描繪銀河系的畫兒在一家著名的畫廊展出。

sentences.english: Ord Mantell has some of the most lenient banking laws in the galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 曼特爾兵站擁有某些銀河系中最寬鬆的銀行法律。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
